reviews.productTitle: GE Single Pole Dimmer Toggle Switch, On/Off/Dim Settings, for Dimmable LED, CFL and Incandescent Bulbs, DIY Project, UL Listed, White, 18025
reviews.text: Bought two of these to replace existing (circa. 2004) wall dimmers which were not LED compatible. I'm using these with GE brand dimmable LED bulbs and everything is working perfectly - Dimming very smoothly & consistently throughout the brightness range. It was annoying to have to replace my old dimmer switches to support LED bulbs, but I am very happy with this purchase.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2025
reviews.title: Work well with decent bulbs

reviews.productTitle: GE Single Pole Dimmer Toggle Switch, On/Off/Dim Settings, for Dimmable LED, CFL and Incandescent Bulbs, DIY Project, UL Listed, White, 18025
reviews.text: I have dim-capable LED lighting on the ceiling. Originally had just a regular switch. Flip, lights full blast. When I put this switch in, flip on with "no dim" and I swear they are all of a sudden not as bright as the regular switch. Maybe I'm seeing things? But then I go to test dimming and it reacts extremely slowly. You have to operate the dim slider at a glacial pace to have any fidelity in the dimming. It's not ideal. I have another dimmer switch from Lutron I'm going to slap in to see what happens tonight. On the positives, the switch operation is very tactile... clunky and positive (unlike many switches sold today that are gummy), it's not ridiculously deep, and it uses screw terminals instead of those incredibly annoying and cheap aluminum wires that just force a crowded electrical box thanks to tons of wire nuts.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2024
reviews.title: I swear the lights don't get as bright with no dimming as a regular switch; dimming is wonky

reviews.productTitle: GE Single Pole Dimmer Toggle Switch, On/Off/Dim Settings, for Dimmable LED, CFL and Incandescent Bulbs, DIY Project, UL Listed, White, 18025
reviews.text: I had this switch installed by an electrician to control an LED ceiling fixture. It worked fine initially and then when I switched it on a couple days later, the light would not come on. Had my electrician come back to look at it. He found there was power going into the switch but no power coming out. He replaced it with a Leviton Sureslide dimmer switch, and now all is well.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2024
reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 days

reviews.text: These switches work great. Worth the money. The switch is silent and the dimmer slide moves easily. A bit too easy really. If your not careful, every time you turn the switch on or off you will move the dimmer portion of the switch as well, causing you to have to readjust the brightness of the light every time you use the switch.

reviews.text: This is an excellent switch for LED bulbs BUT the performance is best when it’s used with GE LED BULBS!!! Specifically the relax and reveal line bulbs!!! Hopefully many people see this review so they can enjoy the range of this dimmer , I’d bet this dims as low as halogen bulbs used to dim when you pair it with GE DIMMABLE LED BULBS!!! A highly recommended switch from me and I have probably 7 of these in our home!

reviews.productTitle: GE Single Pole Dimmer Toggle Switch, On/Off/Dim Settings, for Dimmable LED, CFL and Incandescent Bulbs, DIY Project, UL Listed, White, 18025
reviews.text: I installed it, and immediately removed it. It works - but 90% of the dimming range occurs within the briefest movement of the toggle. If you move it VERY carefully you can set dimming at roughy 40% of brightness, but move it a fraction more and it jumps to 90% of brightness - the rest of the motion changes the brightness very little. In addition, the toggle has no resistance - it moves to easily. It worked - but I wouldn't use it.

reviews.title: Poor Dimming Range

reviews.text: Just got this and installed immediately...very pleased with results with two incandescent floods. This dimmer is old school toggle switch only (no small slider on the side), that's what I wanted. An FYI, fairly big (I imagine it has a circuit board with an IC PWM in it): I mention the size, because it is a tight squeeze in a metal single gang box....but, don't worry......I made it fit. Will be no squeeze at all for use in a single gang blue plastic box.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.title: Oldie but goodie!

reviews.productTitle: GE Single Pole Dimmer Toggle Switch, On/Off/Dim Settings, for Dimmable LED, CFL and Incandescent Bulbs, DIY Project, UL Listed, White, 18025
reviews.text: After installing this replacement toggle dimmer the LED bulbs flickered annoyingly. They worked perfectly with the previous toggle dimmer of another brand which had died after many years of use. Luckily I still had a stash of 60W clear incandescent bulbs so I swapped them out. 2nd issue was when I tried to reinstall the cover plate screws. Despite being carefully lined up they wouldn't even start. A closer look showed that the holes would not accept a 6-32 screw, which has been the USA standard for such screws for decades. Luckily I have an extensive set of machinist taps and was able to properly thread the hole but no one should have to do this. The switch action also feels of low quality and I suspect it will wear out sooner than it should. Bottom Line: Save your money and buy a better brand such as Pass & Seymour.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.title: (POORLY) MADE IN CHINA!

reviews.text: It might work fine in some applications, but it gives very troublesome flickers at some positions when used in my pretty standard under-cabinet light strip. Replacing with a brand that was just a bit more expensive solved the problem. Also, the switch itself has a loose, "cheap" feel.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2023
reviews.title: Limited value

reviews.productTitle: GE Single Pole Dimmer Toggle Switch, On/Off/Dim Settings, for Dimmable LED, CFL and Incandescent Bulbs, DIY Project, UL Listed, White, 18025
reviews.text: Installed to operate an LED fixture over the tub/shower in the main bathroom that is shard by two persons. Usage would be 4 or 5 times a week. After 2 1/2 years the switch failed. Up until then it was great at being able to choose brightness by just the on/off toggle and not having a secondary slider next to the toggle. Bad design or quality control issues? Other switches used to last for decades with higher usage. Just another sign of the times and something we have to accept with so much manufacturing being contracted to third parties overseas and clouded by using formerly strong recognizable U.S. company names.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2023
reviews.title: Malfunction after 2 1/2 years.
